name: CreateGithubBlob
description:
Create a new blob in a GitHub repository.

This tool creates a new blob object in a specified GitHub repository. It is useful when you need to add or modify a blob within the repository, typically for storing binary data or files.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the GitHub repository. This is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the repository. It is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: blob_content
parameters.description: The content for the new GitHub blob. Accepts text or encoded binary data.

parameters.name: content_encoding
parameters.description: Specify the encoding for the blob content. Supported values are 'utf-8' and 'base64'.

value_schema.description: The encoding used for `content`. Currently, `"utf-8"` and `"base64"` are supported.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: The encoding used for `content`. Currently, `"utf-8"` and `"base64"` are supported.

value_schema.description: The encoding used for `content`. Currently, `"utf-8"` and `"base64"` are supported.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
